TypeSignature.Value: public class VisualElement : Xamarin.Forms.Element, Xamarin.Forms.IAnimatable, Xamarin.Forms.IVisualElementController

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit VisualElement extends Xamarin.Forms.Element implements class Xamarin.Forms.IAnimatable, class Xamarin.Forms.IElementController, class Xamarin.Forms.IVisualElementController

Docs.summary: A that occupies an area on the screen, has a visual appearance, and can obtain touch input.

remarks.para: The base class for most Xamarin.Forms on-screen elements. Provides most properties, events, and methods for presenting an item on screen.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the X component of the center point for any transform, relative to the bounds of the element. This is a bindable property.
Docs.value: The value that declares the X component of the transform. The default value is 0.5.

Docs.summary: Identifies the AnchorX bindable property.
Gets or sets the Y component of the center point for any transform, relative to the bounds of the element. This is a bindable property.
Docs.value: The value that declares the Y component of the transform. The default value is 0.5.

Docs.summary: Identifies the AnchorY bindable property.
Gets or sets the color which will fill the background of a VisualElement. This is a bindable property.
Docs.value: The color that is used to fill the background of a VisualElement. The default is .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BatchBegin() cil managed

Docs.summary: Signals the start of a batch of changes to the elements properties.
Docs.remarks: Application authors will not generally need to batch updates manually as the animation framework will do this for them.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BatchCommit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Signals the end of a batch of commands to the element and that those commands should now be committed.
Docs.remarks: This method merely ensures that updates sent during the batch have been committed. It does not ensure that they were not committed before calling this.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance bool Focus() cil managed

Docs.summary: Attemps to set focus to this element.
Docs.returns: if the keyboard focus was set to this element; if the call to this method did not force a focus change.
Docs.remarks: Element must be able to receive focus for this to work. Calling Focus on offscreen or unrealized elements has undefined behavior.

Docs.summary: For internal use by the Xamarin.Forms platform.
Occurs when the element receives focus.
Docs.remarks: Focused event is raised whenever the VisualElement receives focus. This event is not bubbled through the Forms stack and is received directly from the native control. This event is emitted by the IsFocusedProperty setter.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Xamarin.Forms.SizeRequest GetSizeRequest (double widthConstraint, double heightConstraint);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Xamarin.Forms.SizeRequest GetSizeRequest(float64 widthConstraint, float64 heightConstraint) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("OnSizeRequest is obsolete as of version 2.2.0. Please use OnMeasure instead.")

Docs.param: The available width that a parent element can allocated to a child. Value will be between 0 and double.PositiveInfinity.
The available height that a parent element can allocated to a child. Value will be between 0 and double.PositiveInfinity.
Docs.summary: Returns the of the element. Calling this method begins the measure pass of a layout cycle.
Docs.returns: A which contains a requested size and a minimum size.
Docs.remarks: Calling GetSizeRequest causes a measure pass to occur for the subtree of elements it is called on. It is ideal to only call GetSizeRequest when needed as excessive calls can negatively impact the performance of your app. Overriding GetSizeRequest should only be done if you want to ignore Width/HeightRequest. More likely a subclass would wish to override .

Docs.summary: Gets the current rendered height of this element. This is a read-only bindable property.
Docs.value: The renderered height of this element.
Docs.remarks: The height of an element is set during the Layout phase.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty HeightProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the Height bindable property.
Gets or sets the desired height override of this element.
Docs.value: The height this element desires to be.
Docs.remarks: HeightRequest does not immediately change the Bounds of a VisualElement, however setting the HeightRequest will change the result of calls to GetSizeRequest, which will in turn modify the final size the element receives during a layout cycle.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty HeightRequestProperty

Docs.summary: Backing store for the HeightRequest property.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this element should be involved in the user interaction cycle. This is a bindable property.
Docs.value: if the element should receive input; if element should not receive input and should, instead, pass inputs to the element below. Default is .
Docs.remarks: Setting InputTransparent is not the same as setting IsEnabled to false. Setting InputTransparent only disables inputs and instead causes them to be passed to the VisualElement below the element. Usually this is the parent of the element.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty InputTransparentProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the InputTransparent bindable property.

Docs.param: For internal use by the Xamarin.Forms platform.
Docs.summary: For internal use by the Xamarin.Forms platform.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether this element is enabled in the user interface. This is a bindable property.
Docs.value: if the element is enabled; otherwise, . The default value is

remarks.para: Elements that are not enabled do not participate in hit detection, and therefore will not receive focus or emit input events.
The following example shows a handler on a button which will then set IsEnabled to false on another button.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty IsEnabledProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the IsEnabled bindable property.
Gets a value indicating whether this element is focused currently. This is a bindable property.
Docs.value: if the element is focused; otherwise, .

remarks.para: Applications may have multiple focuses depending on the implementation of the underlying toolkit. Menus and modals in particular may leave multiple items with focus.
The following example shows conditionally setting a background color based on the focus state.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether this elements should be part of the visual tree or not. This is a bindable property.
Docs.value: if the element should be rendered; otherwise, . Default value is .

remarks.para: Setting IsVisible to false will remove the element from the visual tree. The element will no longer take up space in layouts or be eligle to receive any kind of input event.
The following example shows a stack where the middle element is toggled when a button is activated.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty IsVisibleProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the IsVisible bindable property.

Docs.param: The new bounds of the element.
Docs.summary: Updates the bounds of the element during the layout cycle.
Docs.remarks: Calling Layout will trigger a layout cycle for the sub-tree of this element.

.method public hidebysig instance valuetype Xamarin.Forms.SizeRequest Measure(float64 widthConstraint, float64 heightConstraint, valuetype Xamarin.Forms.MeasureFlags flags) cil managed

Docs.param: The suggested maximum width constraint for the visual element to render.
The suggested maximum height constraint for the visual element to render.
A value that controls whether margins are included in the returned size.
Docs.summary: Returns the minimum size that a visual element needs in order to be displayed on the device.
Docs.returns: The minimum size that a visual element needs in order to be displayed on the device.

remarks.para: If the minimum sized that the visual element needs in order to be displayed on the device is larger than can be accommodated by and , the return value may represent a rectangle that is larger in either or both of those parameters.

Docs.summary: Event that is raised when the layout of a visual element is invalidated.
Gets or sets a value which overrides the minimum height the element will request during layout.
Docs.value: The minimum height the element requires. Default value is -1.

remarks.para: MinimumHeightRequest is used to override the results of a call to by setting the minimum height property. This causes overflow handling to shrink this element to its minimum height before elements who do not have a minimum size set.
The following example sets the MinimumHeightRequest to enable an image to shrink below it's normal size.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty MinimumHeightRequestProperty

Docs.summary: Backing store for the MinimumHeightRequest property.
Gets or sets a value which overrides the minimum width the element will request during layout.
Docs.value: The minimum width the element requires. Default value is -1.

remarks.para: MinimumWidthRequest is used to override the results of a call to by setting the minimum width property. This causes overflow handling to shrink this element to its minimum width before elements who do not have a minimum size set.
The following example sets the MinimumWidthRequest to enable an image to shrink below it's normal size.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty MinimumWidthRequestProperty

Docs.summary: Backing store for the MinimumWidthRequest property.

Docs.summary: For internal use by the Xamarin.Forms platform.
Gets the context aware navigation interface for the element.
Docs.value: An that allows for navigation using the ancestral navigation implementor.

remarks.para: Use the Navigation property to perform navigation from any element. If the element has not yet been added to a tree which contains a navigation implementor, the actions are queued up until it is.
The following example navigates to a new page created in the callback of a buttons event.

Docs.summary: Invoked whenever the event is about to be emitted. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
Docs.remarks: This method has no default implementation. You should still call the base implementation in case an intermediate class has implemented this method.

Docs.summary: Method that is called when a layout measurement happens.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void OnParentSet() cil managed

Docs.summary: Invoked whenever the Parent of an element is set. Implement this method in order to add behavior when the element is added to a parent.
Docs.remarks: It is required to call the base implementation.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual void OnSizeAllocated (double width, double height);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnSizeAllocated(float64 width, float64 height) cil managed

Docs.param: The new width of the element.
The new height of the element.
Docs.summary: This method is called when the size of the element is set during a layout cycle. This method is called directly before the event is emitted. Implement this method to add class handling for this event.
Docs.remarks: This method has no default implementation. You should still call the base implementation in case an intermediate class has implemented this method. Most layouts will want to implement this method in order to layout their children during a layout cycle.

MemberSignature.Value: protected virtual Xamarin.Forms.SizeRequest OnSizeRequest (double widthConstraint, double heightConstraint);
.method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype Xamarin.Forms.SizeRequest OnSizeRequest(float64 widthConstraint, float64 heightConstraint) cil managed

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("OnSizeRequest is obsolete as of version 2.2.0. Please use OnMeasure instead.")

Docs.param: The available width for the element to use.
The available height for the element to use.
Docs.summary: This method is called during the measure pass of a layout cycle to get the desired size of an element.
Docs.returns: A which contains the desired size of the element.
Docs.remarks: The results of this method will be (-1, -1) if the element has not yet been realized with a platform specific backing control. Overriding this method does not require a call to the base class so long as a valid SizeRequest is returned.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the opacity value applied to the element when it is rendered. This is a bindable property.
Docs.value: The opacity value. Default opacity is 1.0. Values will be clamped between 0 and 1 on set.

remarks.para: The opacity value has no effect unless IsVisible is . Opacity is inherited down the element hierarchy. If a parent has 0.5 opacity, and a child has 0.5 opacity, the child will render with an effective 0.25 opacity. Setting opacity to 0 has undefined behavior with input elements.
The following example sets the opacity of a layout to 0.5 and the opacity of one of its children to 0.5, making the child 25% opaque.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty OpacityProperty

Docs.summary: Identifies the Opacity bindable property.
Gets or sets the local resource dictionary.
Docs.value: The current resource dictionary, where resources are stored by key.

remarks.para: In XAML, resource dictionaries are filled with key/value pairs that are specified in XML and consequently created at run time. The keys in the resource dictionary are specified with the x:Key attribute of the XML tag for the type to create. An object of that type is created, and is initialized with the property and field values that are specified either by additional attributes or by nested tags, both of which, when present are simply string representations of the property or field names. The object is then inserted into the for the enclosing type at runtime.

example.para: For example, the XAML below, taken from the XAML for Xamarin.Forms series, creates a resource dictionary that contains object constants that can be used for any objects that are added to the surrounding :

Note that the above snippet is only valid when nested within a <ContentPage>...</ContentPage> tag pair. Within that pair, the app developer can use both of the horzOptions and vertOptions keys to specify values for properties of type by using the "{...}" static resource syntax. The short example below, also taken from the XAML for Xamarin.Forms series, illustrates this syntax:
example.code: <Button Text="Do this!" HorizontalOptions="{StaticResource horzOptions}" VerticalOptions="{StaticResource vertOptions}" BorderWidth="3" Rotation="-15" TextColor="Red" Font="Large" />
example.para: Resource dictionaries and their associated XML provide the application developer with a convenient method to reuse code inside the XAML compile-time and run-time engines.

Docs.summary: SizeAllocated is called during a layout cycle to signal the start of a sub-tree layout.
Docs.remarks: Calling SizeAllocated will start a new layout cycle on the children of the element. Excessive calls to SizeAllocated may cause performance problems.

Docs.summary: Occurs when either the Width or the Height properties change value on this element.
Docs.remarks: Classes should implement if they wish to respond to size change events directly.

Gets or sets the X translation delta of the element.
Docs.value: The amount to translate the element.
Docs.remarks: Translation is applied post layout. It is particularly good for applying animations. Translating an element outside the bounds of its parent container may prevent inputs from working.

Docs.summary: Unsets focus to this element.
Docs.remarks: Element must already have focus for this to have any effect.

Docs.summary: Occurs when the element loses focus.
Docs.remarks: Unfocused event is raised whenever the VisualElement loses focus. This event is not bubbled through the Forms stack and is received directly from the native control. This event is emitted by the IsFocusedProperty setter.
